articles.headline: Hamas and Israel Extend Cease-Fire for 2 Days, Qatar Says
articles.snippet: The extension, and another exchange of hostages and prisoners, raised hopes that more people would be set free and more humanitarian aid would reach people in the Gaza Strip.
articles.abstract: The extension, and another exchange of hostages and prisoners, raised hopes that more people would be set free and more humanitarian aid would reach people in the Gaza Strip.
articles.lead_paragraph: Israel and Hamas agreed on Monday to extend by two days a cease-fire that has brought a measure of calm to the Gaza Strip after seven weeks of intense warfare, the Qatari government said. The two sides struck a deal to exchange more hostages and prisoners and allow more aid into the beleaguered territory.
articles.byline: By Talya Minsberg, Yara Bayoumy and Vivian Yee

articles.headline: New Bidder Aims to Save Bankrupt Trucking Firm, if Creditors Go Along
articles.snippet: The plan would put Yellow back on the road with thousands of unionized drivers, but would force the government to wait longer for a loan repayment.
articles.abstract: The plan would put Yellow back on the road with thousands of unionized drivers, but would force the government to wait longer for a loan repayment.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Yellow abruptly shuttered its operations in the summer and filed for bankruptcy protection, few thought that a buyer would emerge and try to revive the long-troubled trucking giant.

articles.headline: Gold Bars and Tokyo Apartments: How Money Is Flowing Out of China.
articles.snippet: Chinese families are sending money overseas, a sign of worry about the country’s economic and political future. But a cheaper currency is also helping exports.
articles.abstract: Chinese families are sending money overseas, a sign of worry about the country’s economic and political future. But a cheaper currency is also helping exports.
articles.lead_paragraph: Affluent Chinese have moved hundreds of billions of dollars out of the country this year, seizing on the end of Covid precautions that had almost completely sealed China’s borders for nearly three years.
articles.byline: By Keith Bradsher and Joy Dong

articles.headline: Even Most Biden Voters Don’t See a Thriving Economy
articles.snippet: A majority of those who backed President Biden in 2020 say today’s economy is fair or poor, ordinarily a bad omen for incumbents seeking re-election.
articles.abstract: A majority of those who backed President Biden in 2020 say today’s economy is fair or poor, ordinarily a bad omen for incumbents seeking re-election.
articles.lead_paragraph: Presidents seeking a second term have often found the public’s perception of the economy a pivotal issue. It was a boon to Ronald Reagan; it helped usher Jimmy Carter and George H.W. Bush out of the White House.

articles.headline: Can U.S.-China Student Exchanges Survive Geopolitics?
articles.snippet: The flow of students between the countries has been a mainstay of their relationship, even when ties have soured. Now these exchanges, too, are under threat.
articles.abstract: The flow of students between the countries has been a mainstay of their relationship, even when ties have soured. Now these exchanges, too, are under threat.
articles.lead_paragraph: On a cool Saturday morning, in a hotel basement in Beijing, throngs of young Chinese gathered to do what millions had done before them: dream of an American education.

articles.headline: Gavin Newsom Wants Fox News Viewers to Hear Him Out
articles.snippet: After sparring twice with Sean Hannity, Gov. Gavin Newsom of California will jump into the ring this week with Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida. The stakes are high for both men.
articles.abstract: After sparring twice with Sean Hannity, Gov. Gavin Newsom of California will jump into the ring this week with Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida. The stakes are high for both men.
articles.lead_paragraph: Gavin Newsom has a scant history of tough debates over his two decades as governor and lieutenant governor of California and mayor of San Francisco.
